subject: Photography
title: The Polaroid Instant
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Polaroid Instant.

hook.text: In 1948, you could take a photo and hold the print in your hand sixty seconds later. It felt like magic.

buildup.text: Edwin Land invented the Polaroid camera after his daughter asked why she couldn't see a photo right away.

discovery.text: The Polaroid printed itself. No darkroom, no waiting, no film processing. Instant gratification.

twist.text: Artists loved it. Andy Warhol shot Polaroids obsessively. The format became both democratic and collectible.

climax.text: The Polaroid predicted the future: instant sharing. Decades later, Instagram borrowed its iconic square format.

punchline.text: A child's question invented instant photography.

quiz.question: What inspired Edwin Land to create the Polaroid camera?
options: His daughter asked why she couldn't see a photo immediately
He wanted to compete with Kodak
